title: Sim_card
author: Sim_card
content: Ever since I joined this forum, I have read so many topics of forum members introducing bitcoin to people around them for the fast growth of bitcoin adoption. I saw that there are some people that are missing from this great innovation and this set of people can be the leaders of tomorrow, and this are the orphans in the orphanage homes. This kept me wondering that how will these orphans also have bitcoin knowledge and maybe they can also be part of the bitcoin community in future. If they know the basic of bitcoin from now, as time passes on they might pick interest to know more about bitcoin, since bitcoin will soon be the talk of the town everywhere you go.I went on charity work to the Diasy orphanage home in my LGA today which happens to be my birthday to present them with gifts and food items, and I  used this opportunity to introduce bitcoin to them, telling them that all I brought to them was gotten through bitcoin. Today is my first time to celebrate my birthday with orphans and as you can see I am in Diasy orphanage home to put smiles on the face of the orphans because this is the season to show love to people around us. I have introduced bitcoin to these lovely children after I presented the gifts to them. Mrs Inita Amaduwgu is the owner of the orphanage home and she was happy with the introduction of bitcoin to the orphans and her workers. She said that she will create time for me to come back and teach her workers, when the children have gone to school, so that they can also teach the children at their own convenient time. I gave gave them a cartoon video on bitcoin so that the younger children will not be left out.I feel very excited and have this joy in me for what I did today, and I said let me share it with you all. I thank the Almighty God for giving me the grace be plus one today.My thanks goes to julierz12 and [banned mixer] team for giving me the opportunity to work with them, because it was the money from my signature campaign that I used to buy those gifts. I also give thanks to all forum members who have motivated me in one way or the other. I wish you all a merry Xmas and a Happy New year in advance.[img width=]https://talkimg.com/images/2023/12/18/EOAIc.jpeg[/img]

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: You have done soo well Sim_card this is a perfect way to celebrate the Christmas season as Christmas is all about showing love. +1merit

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: You have done a double-good job. First of all, you provide food for orphans and make them smile for a while. And another thing is that you adapt Bitcoin directly to a large number of people. They may have established a near future and may be interested in Bitcoin. I appreciate this initiative. Most likely, crypto currency is legal in your jurisdiction; hence, you adapt Bitcoin. I wish to do something like this, to be honest. But I am hopeless that my government has declared illegal any activities related to cryptocurrency. So I can't adapt Bitcoin publicly, though I can adapt it with friends and family. Good luck to you!

comments.author: MArsland
comments.body: You point the way to truth, no wonder many Nigerians are always at the forefront in showing developments regarding how to spread goodness through Bitcoin. I have seen it on this forum many times, activities that trigger us to emulate. Not being able to afford it on a large scale, at least I might only be able to do it with a small family. From what you have shown, Bitcointalk is a bridge for you to do this good and I am very happy to see it. An orphanage is the right place for your goals.The more you make them smile at your kindness, the more your income will multiply in unexpected ways. Giving doesn't have to wait for you to get rich, right? that's the poin here.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: First I will say happy birthday to you!The secondly your kindness for showing those children love especially this festive season there are many people out there who doesn't know what to eat talking of good clothes to wear for the Xmas. There are lots of us here who are also generous in giving but doesn't like sharing here so it wouldn't be like a competition or just like people are using that method to attract merits, like few days I emptied my drawer and give out most of my expensive shoes and clothes to them just to show love to my fellow woman.I do this not because those clothes and shoes is old or not okay for me to use them but no, I basically selected them out to give those ladies I saw around my street because there's no reason I will have hundreds of pair of shoes and lots of clothes inside my Waldrop and my fellow women will walk on bare foot. We talks about love but most of us don't practice it instead they prefer selling them out to people than give or buy for them.Usually I love to have posted them but feels it wasn't necessary to start displaying every single items shared to people or given to people just to come show to forum about what we give or not, I didn't say you've done wrong any but I want to commend you on the good thing you have done and may you continue doing it. Our God will see you through.

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: Honoring what you have done to orphans, this is because of your success in earning through bitcoin and it can be utilized by you to others by introducing them early on as well as watching cartoons about the journey of bitcoin.I see now that many communities have cared about people who need it, they do charity like you on their birthday, this may be your achievement because you have managed to spend your income on them at the orphanage.Anyway, I am amazed if someone does good deeds.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Sim_card on December 18, 2023, 06:33:58 PMToday is my first time to celebrate my birthday with orphans and as you can see I am in Diasy orphanage home to put smiles on the face of the orphans because this is the season to show love to people around us.This is a good act, and I love the fact you were able to celebrate your this year's birthday with orphans, by providing food and teaching them the basic knowledge about Bitcoin, which indirectly, I must confess, you just successfully laid a foundation into the minds of our future Bitcoin/Blockchain enthusiasts. As this will ignite in them the spirit of wanting to know more about this Bitcoin you just introduced them to this day. Hence, I wish you all the best, as you strive to encourage those in need at your locality.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: You have done well by taking this bold step to the motherless baby home. I am happy you did this, mate. I think I should let you know that we are birthday buddies, and, to be honest with you, I did mine, and I chose not to make it public as I have decided to do it within my capacity to avoid publicity as I used to do back then. It is a thing of joy to take up such a task as putting food on the tables of people you know nothing about. This has always been my plan for a long time, and this year the resources availed itself, and I made good use of the opportunity. I choose not to make things of this nature public anymore because I believe everyone gets their rewards based on their input, and I see it as not necessary to make them public.I will commend you for your good work, mate. It is nice that you took this step at this time when things are very difficult. I was having that thought too, but I had to summon up the courage to accomplish the task, and it was a task worth it. I am glad they were happy as I left them today, and I believe you too were fulfilled with your task today.Merry Christmas to you too!

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Yes, I do believed that we should share our blessings, specially in this Christmas season, it's gift giving and that should include BTC as well, so kudos to you. And definitely it's good to also introduce bitcoin to orphans as it is for everyone.Who knows, maybe one day, those orphans might find someone who will adopt them permanently and perhaps get a good life, be educated and then didn't forget when you came to their orphanage and introduce bitcoin and someone struck in their minds. So in the future, learn about it and then become a investors and make them financially grow and have a good life.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Advance Merry Christmas and prosperous New Year to you OP and to everyone. Also, happy birthday.Wow, you did an amazing job for having this thought of going to the orphanage and shared not just knowledge and food but also love. Keep it up and continue doing charity work as it will bring back more to you.

comments.author: stadus
comments.body: Great job OP. You become an instrument to make these children feel loved and joy in this holiday season, and of course in your natal day.  Your intention is to spread out awareness to these kids who might be the future of bitcoin has become successful and definitely brings happiness to them because aside from the new knowledge that they have gained, they were able to receive foods and presents as well that made them excited again for your next visit.What you did is a noble one. Hopefully, you can share more blessings to them and continue to teach them and open their minds about bitcoin and its future. When their interest develops, they can make extended research on that if they wish to.

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Feel proud of the achievements of people who are able to vary with needy children like them. This is a good move that everyone needs to emulate, that not many people are as lucky as us. I even did the same thing a few hours ago, giving some food to children with disabilities, but I wasn't brave enough to confront them to introduce Bitcoin (my messy public speaking). But even though I didn't introduce Bitcoin to them right away, I explained to the accompanying teacher that what I got and gave was all sourced from Bitcoin and this Forum.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Feel proud that you have shared your knowledge about cryptocurrency by teaching them about it and since you teach them about cryptocurrency then that means you invite people to be involved in crypto field especially young people. Since you have shared your knowledge in crypto then it's up to them if they are going to do it or not . It's up to them to decide whether to join or not and then you'll see which one of them are interested and those who aren't interested.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Well done my friend. Not only you have achieved your goal in going to that orphanage, but you have also inspired the children around you to get to know more bitcoin not only because it's necessary but because the future of these kids might rely on bitcoin. Most probably, these kids have find it hard to understand bitcoin at first but if you can teach them at a consistent basis, I mean by visiting them again the next time you're available, then you can expect that they will meet satisfaction learning about bitcoin and its future.Promotion of bitcoin should definitely start on the younger minds of children simply because they are keen observers and good listeners. Once they have absorbed that, then they will continue to bring up that knowledge in every stages of their growth and development.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: I pround seeing people share their happiness with others – especially those in need. Sharing will not make us less - but it is the best way to get more. Sim_card - good job from you.During this time I also enjoyed sharing and helping other people - but I always obliged myself not to announce it anywhere, including on forum. Of course this isn't just about bitcoin - but any form of charity I'm not prepared to make public. You can do it for your own reasons - it's fine to you, but it might be considered bad by some people especially if you want to get appreciation from forum users in any form.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: Well, you are a blessing to them. We are proud of you, bro. It takes dedication to help people and share your knowledge with them, and you did a good job on how you introduced them to the concept of bitcoin. I'm sure they listen to you as you also give them a gift that is very valuable to them. Now that you've introduced them to bitcoin, I hope some will be interested and will ask for your help or guidance on how they can start with this field, and from your nature, I think you are willing to teach them. It will be great if many young generations will have an idea of what bitcoin or crypto currency is so that they will have an option on how they will survive this world. As they are orphans, they will learn to earn by themselves, which is a very good development for them and for the community.The only problem I see is the resources. I hope they will have a device and access to the internet so they can explore more about this field of crypto currency, or bitcoin, because you are not there all the time, so they also need to explore. Anyway, we are grateful for your act of service and contribution to spreading the word about bitcoin.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: OP, you did well by sharing your hard earned with the less privilege (orphans) and that wisdom of your endivoirs is sure of admirable.Devoting your time teaching the orphanage home workers is an excellent but considering the cartoonized Bitcoin video for the kids, I hope it only ends an entertainment to them and not literarily having that mindset of acquiring its knowledge and craving to make wealth? Because at the point of anyone having that thoughtfulness of making money, it is accompanied with a harden minds on risk taking in other to succeed on the wealthy journey so, such is not so advisable for kids.Let them approach to the promising age of taking charge or their emotions and likey they decide what they want to be in life and let it put to efforts.However, I hope to hear that the orphanages management would say somedays to theri cheerful givers that "they now accepts Bitcoin transactions" in case anyone has it an option.

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: OP you have done a great job and I congratulate you from the bottom of my heart. God always helps those who put food in the mouths of orphans. Also the fact that you discussed Bitcoin with poor orphans caught everyone's attention. If every Bitcoin customer has the same thoughts as you, surely Bitcoin will be more popular and will go to its peak of popularity. There are still many neglected areas where Bitcoin has not touched. If there is a kind person like you in all those countries/regions, the use of Bitcoin will reach the neglected areas very easily. I think the poor kids you discussed bitcoin with can have a better future if they learn something good about bitcoin from you and earn from it. I thank you again for your important good work. Good luck to you as you move forward.

comments.author: AirtelBuzz
comments.body: You should be proud of your work because you have done a great job by putting food in the mouths of orphans.Not many people are lucky enough to help orphans with their earnings but you can do it with your earned bitcoins.All those who are a little rich should stand by the poor or the orphans as you have done.You tried to convince the orphans about Bitcoin maybe they will understand that your efforts will be successful.Finally welcome to celebrate your birthday in a beautiful way.Maybe celebrating this birthday will be an exception for you compared to celebrating other birthdays.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Great work dude.Although we have seen a lot of stories like this, it doesn't stop anyone from telling their own unique story. It will motivate the others who are yet to do this and it will be for posterity.  You did a basic intro to bitcoin and conveyed your message to the kids in the most appropriate and enjoyable manner - cartoon. I love cartoon while I was a kid and even now as an adult. You have sown a seed in their hearts. There are some challenges that you may face along the way if you want to go further in this bitcoin education with the staff of the orphanage which may be:time constraint - the staff will always be busy with the kids. Even when they go to school, there are still toddlers who will demand for their attention. Most of these organization to the best of my knowledge are understaffed. I therefore don't know how they will squeeze out time for it.Financial challenge -  The reality on ground is that they may want to have physical money than have bitcoin that takes a long time before its yields a good return.Educational level - I do not know the education level of these staff, but I know that most of them may not be college graduates. How will they understand the other concepts if you delve deeper into it?
